title: What are some examples of ethical questions? - Quora

response.answer_text: Natural morality comes from having pro-social tendencies, which are based on the ability to have empathy and to understand what it means to be fair with the resources in the community. Most animals that live in herds or packs understand the value of maintaining a cohesive unit for survival. Humans however, are weak. Deferring authority and decision-making to a handful of individuals who exploit everyone’s weaknesses for personal gain. Nobody bothers to stand up to these megalomaniacs. Here’s some ethical questions: Are you willing to take another person job by working for a wage less than what he or she needs to survive? If you are then you are unethical.Are you willing to pay less for pharmaceuticals if it means people in another country must make up the difference in cost, sending many of those people into bankruptcy or an early grave because they can’t afford medicine? If so, then you are unethical.Are you willing to sell your crop exports at a lower price if it means farmers in another country will lost their land and go bankrupt, some of whom will commit suicide?

Are there any times or circumstances where lying, stealing, adultery, or murder is justified? Are there times or circumstances under which the destruction of biodiversity or inefficiency can be justified? Are there times when individual or minority rights are more important than majority rights? Can special interest laws benefiting only minorities be justified? Should males and females be treated alike in all cases legally or is gender equality valid in all circumstances? Should there be enforced safety standards such as drug, motorized vehicle, and pollution laws?
